title: Parsha Bereishit: In the Beginning
description: We begin at the beginning - exploring creation, purpose, and what it means to be made in the divine image. This week we dive into the story of Adam and Eve and what their journey teaches us about our own relationship with choice, consciousness, and connection.

title: Parsha Noach: Starting Over
description: The story of Noah isn't just about a flood - it's about what it means to rebuild, to start fresh, and to hold hope even when everything around you seems to be falling apart. We explore themes of renewal, faith, and finding solid ground.

title: Parsha Lech Lecha: Go Forth
description: Abraham's journey begins with two simple words: Lech Lecha - go forth. But where? And why? This week we explore what it means to leave the familiar behind and step into your calling, even when you can't see the destination.

title: Parsha Vayera: Seeing Clearly
description: When angels visit Abraham, he sees them immediately - but Lot has to be convinced. What does it mean to truly see? This week we dive into perception, hospitality, and recognizing the sacred in the ordinary.

title: Parsha Chayei Sarah: A Life Well-Lived
description: Sarah's life story teaches us about legacy, purpose, and what it means to live fully. We explore how to honor our past while creating space for what wants to emerge, and what it looks like to live with intention.

title: Parsha Toldot: Family Patterns
description: Isaac, Rebecca, Jacob, and Esau - a family story that feels surprisingly modern. This week we look at generational patterns, sibling dynamics, and how to break cycles while honoring where we come from.

title: Parsha Vayetzei: Dreams and Ladders
description: Jacob's dream of a ladder reaching to heaven isn't just a pretty image - it's a map for spiritual living. We explore what it means to live between heaven and earth, dreams and reality, the spiritual and the practical.

title: Parsha Vayishlach: Wrestling with the Divine
description: Jacob wrestles with an angel all night and emerges changed, wounded, and blessed. What does it mean to wrestle with the divine? This week we explore spiritual struggle, transformation, and finding blessing in our battles.

title: Parsha Vayeshev: The Dreamer
description: Joseph's coat, his dreams, and his brothers' jealousy - a story about vision, purpose, and what happens when you see a bigger picture that others can't yet understand. We explore calling, resilience, and trusting your inner knowing.

title: Parsha Miketz: From Pit to Palace
description: Joseph rises from prisoner to second-in-command of Egypt. This week we explore what it means to trust the process, find meaning in our trials, and recognize that sometimes our greatest struggles prepare us for our greatest service.
